com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen

Class CustomHoverIcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.CustomHoverIcon

  • public class CustomHoverIcon
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows setting a custom hovering cursor for an Android View.

    After creating an object, register a listener to the View using View.setOnHoverListener and call onHover(View, MotionEvent) from within that callback. from within that callback.

    See Also:
    android.view.View

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomHoverIcon(Drawable drawable, int hotSpotX, int hotSpotY)
      Specify a custom hover cursor for a view.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkSupport()
      Check if the framework supports custom hovering cursor
      void onHover(View view, MotionEvent event)
      Call from your a view's registered OnHoverListener.onHover event to change the cursor as it enters and leaves the view's area.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomHoverIcon

        public CustomHoverIcon(Drawable drawable,
               int hotSpotX,
               int hotSpotY)
        Specify a custom hover cursor for a view. Specify a hot-spot other than (0,0) for cursors with natural "pointing spot" not at the top-left corner. For example, a circle cursor will have a hot-spot at the center of the bitmap
        Parameters:
        drawable - The hovering cursor drawable
        hotSpotX - x location of hot-spot for cursor offset adjustment
        hotSpotY - y location of hot-spot for cursor offset adjustment

    • Method Detail

      • onHover

        public void onHover(View view,
           MotionEvent event)
        Call from your a view's registered OnHoverListener.onHover event to change the cursor as it enters and leaves the view's area.
        Parameters:
        view - the view argument from the OnHoverListener.onHover call
        event - the event argument from the OnHoverListener.onHover call

      • checkSupport

        public static boolean checkSupport()
        Check if the framework supports custom hovering cursor
        Returns:
        true if feature is supported
